result.execSummary:
The defendant Melanie A Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ozaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes: -Extended supervision conditions same as listed under probation conditions with exception of jail term.

miscConds.notes: Defendant may file a written request for hearing on the restitution within 30 days if she wishes to contest the amount. Court states once defendant is released from custody she would be able to commence payments toward the restitution amount. Victim, J.L.,  to be paid first then insurance company. If insurance company not paid w/in 6 months, civil judgment to be entered.

Defendant must continue payment of $50 per month toward attorney fees until paid in full. Failure to pay may result in a commitment consecutive to current jail term. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

-Defendant may not be employed as a caregiver.
-Defendant may not have access to business money or employment with access to money.
-Defendant to submit DNA sample.
-Pay supervision fees.
